node.title: 'Are you OK?': Ruben lost his dad to suicide at age 14, now he helps others in need
node.alt: Ruben and his mum Ella now find solace in helping others get through their crises as Lifeline volunteers
node.description: As a teenager, Ruben was heartbroken and struggled to understand why his father took his own life. Eleven years later, he now volunteers as a phone counsellor at Lifeline to help save the lives of others.
node.content:
["In 2010, 14-year-old Ruben was heartbroken and struggled to understand why\u00a0his father took his own life. Now, 11\u00a0years later, he volunteers to help people in need as a phone counsellor at Lifeline.", "\"What I wish I could have done for my dad, I want to create that impact for people in need now,\" Ruben said.", "The young man from Sydney's north said his family was unprepared to deal with the effect of his father's suicide at the time.", "\"The way my father left had a detrimental effect on my family and it will always be a part of us,\" he said.", "", "
Ruben says his father hid his emotions and internal struggles for many years.(ABC Radio Sydney: Michael Luu)
", "\"I was asking myself if I had done or said something that could have led to him taking his own life.", "\"One of the worst problems I had was keeping quiet and closed off during that time, which put me in a vulnerable position.\"", "It took years for the teenage Ruben\u00a0to overcome the turmoil. He did it by\u00a0reaching out to counsellors, family and friends.", "\"It took a lot of strength and encouragement to accept that he made the decision himself and we were not to blame for his passing.", "\"My support circle made a massive difference to my situation and shaped the kind of man I am and sorts of conversations I have today.\"", "
'I wanted to do my part'
", "Ruben said an \"unusual conversation over beers\" with a Lifeline volunteer sparked his interest in joining the suicide prevention organisation.\u00a0", "\"We talked about how to contribute to society, and my mate's experience of helping people in need really struck a chord with me.", "\"Because I have been through it myself, I know what it takes to rise above the struggle and wanted to do my part.\"", "", "
Ruben wishes he had been able to help his father.(ABC Radio Sydney: Michael Luu)
", "Having worked with Lifeline for more than\u00a0two years, the volunteer says his \"own lived experiences\" help him relate to some callers in crisis and \"connect with them on a deeper level\".", "\"Because I have been through it myself, I know what it takes to rise above the struggle.\"", "", "
Ruben says his personal experiences of overcoming crises help him empathise with callers better.(ABC Radio Sydney: Michael Luu\u00a0)
", "Ruben wishes he could have had more time to help his late father \"unpack the unspoken burden\".", "\"Time and time again, I often ask myself what a difference I would have been able to make if the 14-year-old me had known how to talk to my dad and ask him 'are you okay?'", "\"He always appeared tough and resilient to stop people from worrying, while he was carrying a lot of baggage on his own.\"\u00a0", "
A salve for the hurt and trauma
", "Ruben's work has inspired his mum, Ella, to train as a crisis supporter at Lifeline.", "She said she felt a sense of guilt after losing her husband to suicide.", "\"My son has become a very insightful young man and become very open with me about what is going in his own life since he became a crisis supporter.", "\"His passion and enthusiasm really rubbed off on me.\"", "", "
Ella finds her work as a crisis supporter to be a journey of \"healing\".(ABC Radio Sydney: Michael Luu)
", "
Giving people hope
", "Ella is now a phone-counsellor-in-training at Lifeline and is set to graduate by the end of the year.", "\"We learn great listening skills to allow people to express themselves and get things off their chest,\" she said.", "\"As volunteers, we don't fix people's problems but instead give them hope and tools to help themselves.", "\"It is a special experience to be a part of a person's life and be there for them at their dire moment of need.\"", "Ella said\u00a0making a difference to a people's lives was a \"rewarding and eye-opening experience\".", "\"When I hear a caller's voice being lighter and they share that they don't feel as burdened anymore or are committed to making positive changes to their lives, I can not ask for a greater reward.", "\"Our sense of awareness has really increased about the people and world around us.\""]
